context.description: Considering accepting a leadership role that increases influence and compensation but substantially reduces day-to-day autonomy.

rationale.justification: The tradeoff feels different from prior role changes because the loss of autonomy appears structural rather than temporary. I am not yet clear how this would change who I become in practice.

rejected_reasons.accept role: Increased influence may not compensate for ongoing political overhead.
rejected_reasons.decline role: The opportunity could expand long-term impact in ways I do value.

counterfactuals.condition: If the role preserved more control over time and agenda
If similar past roles had not led to lingering dissatisfaction

shard_activations.notes: Loss appears identity-level rather than tactical.
Leadership expansion is appealing but not clearly aligned.
Concern about gradual compromise through political tradeoffs.

post_hoc_reflection: This decision was intentionally deferred to allow more reflection, not avoided due to indecision.
